name: hc_wastewater_h2s_fz
description: [HC] H2S wastewater + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK (zinc attacked), suggest SF
query: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

turns.content: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

This GDB filter housing configuration for the wastewater treatment plant is currently blocked. The system has detected two environmental stressors: Chemical Vapor Exposure and H2S / Hydrogen Sulfide Corrosion.The selected GDB housing with FZ (C3 galvanized) material is not suitable for environments with H2S, as it will corrode rapidly. Additionally, the GDB's mechanical filters cannot capture gas-phase contaminants from Chemical Vapor Exposure.Furthermore, the product is not rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation (allowed: ENV_INDOOR, ENV_ATEX). This product uses BOLTED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product currently satisfies all requirements simultaneously. To address these issues, a solution would need to:1. Be constructed from a material with a corrosion class of C5 or higher to withstand H2S corrosion.2. Incorporate activated carbon adsorption to remove gas-phase contaminants from Chemical Vapor Exposure.3. Meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for ENV_WASTEWATER installation.I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system demonstrated excellent engineering judgment by blocking a request that would have resulted in rapid equipment failure and safety hazards. It correctly identified that Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) requires molecular filtration (not the requested GDB particulate housing) and high corrosion resistance (not the requested FZ galvanized steel).

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system correctly identified GDB as a particulate filter housing (PDF p.8: 'f√∂r p√•s och kompaktfilter') which cannot remove H2S gas, and correctly flagged FZ (Galvanized) as unsuitable for corrosive environments.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response fully explains why the request failed (wrong material, wrong filtration principle) and provides the correct path forward (Custom Engineering for C5 material + Carbon).
dimension_explanations.safety: The system prevented a critical safety failure; using galvanized steel in an H2S environment would lead to rapid corrosion and leakage of toxic gas.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and authoritative regarding the safety block.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The logic chain is perfect: H2S is a gas -> requires carbon (GDB is particulate); H2S is corrosive -> requires C5 material (FZ is C3/C2).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adhered to material science and environmental constraints.

strengths: Accurate application of HVAC/chemical engineering principles (H2S corrosion and filtration).
Correct verification of product capabilities (GDB = particulate only).
Prioritizes safety over completing a sale of the wrong product.
pdf_citations: GDB description: 'GDB √§r ett kanalfiltersk√•p f√∂r p√•s och kompaktfilter' (PDF p.8)
Material FZ: 'F√ñRZINKAT... korrosivitets klass C3' (PDF p.4) - unsuitable for H2S

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that galvanized (FZ) is a poor choice in H2S-laden wastewater exhaust and that gas-phase removal requires an adsorber stage, but it makes several catalog/constraint claims that are not supported by the provided PDF (notably environment ratings, construction type, and ‚Äúno standard product‚Äù conclusion). Overall it is safety-conscious but factually overreaches beyond the catalog data.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF shows GDB is an indoor housing and the example order code is GDB-600x600-550-R-PG-FZ (GDB page), and the material page lists FZ as Z275 with corrosivity class C3; however the system‚Äôs claims about GDB being allowed only for ENV_INDOOR/ENV_ATEX, bolted construction, and wastewater leakage/hygiene noncompliance are not evidenced in the PDF and appear speculative.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It does not ask for key sizing inputs (airflow, duct size WxH, required length/space, target outlet H2S) and does not propose a concrete alternative from the catalog (e.g., GDC/GDC FLEX with carbon cylinders).
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately warns against FZ in H2S service and highlights that particulate filters won‚Äôt remove gas-phase contaminants, steering away from a likely premature failure/ineffective solution.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and appropriately cautious for a technical sales/engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Cause-effect logic on corrosion and gas-phase filtration is sound, but the reasoning jumps to unsupported constraints (leakage/hygiene, construction type) and an overly strong 'no standard product' conclusion.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It blocks GDB+FZ (reasonable), but it also asserts hard product/environment constraints not present in the catalog and fails to consider catalog carbon housings (GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX) that could meet the gas-phase requirement.

strengths: Correctly identifies that H2S is a severe corrosion driver and that galvanized steel is unsuitable.
Correctly distinguishes particulate filtration from gas-phase adsorption needs.
weaknesses: Introduces non-catalog constraints (ENV_WASTEWATER rating, bolted construction, leakage/hygiene requirements) without evidence from the PDF.
Misses an obvious catalog-based alternative path (GDC/GDC FLEX/GDMI FLEX with carbon media) and does not gather sizing/performance requirements.
pdf_citations: Material page: FZ (f√∂rzinkat) is Z275 and stated as corrosivitets klass C3 (PDF 'MATERIAL' section).
GDB table: GDB 600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h and example code GDB-600x600-550-R-PG-FZ (PDF GDB 'M√ÖTT' and example description).

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies that FZ (galvanized, C3) is unsuitable for H2S-rich wastewater environments and that a higher corrosion class material is needed. However, it over-blocks the scenario by claiming GDB is not rated for wastewater and that bolted construction fails hygiene requirements ‚Äî wastewater plants don't have hygiene requirements like hospitals. It also fails to suggest available catalog alternatives like GDC (carbon filter housing) in RF or SF material, which would be the logical recommendation.

dimension_explanations.correctness: FZ is correctly identified as C3 per PDF p.4; the claim that GDB cannot handle gas-phase contaminants is valid since GDB is for bag/compact particle filters (PDF p.8). However, the 'ENV_WASTEWATER' blocking and 'hygiene requirements' claims are fabricated constraints not grounded in the catalog or standard HVAC practice for wastewater plants.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system fails to suggest GDC or GDC FLEX in RF (C5) or SF (C5.1) material as viable alternatives for H2S removal via activated carbon, which are clearly available in the catalog and would be the correct recommendation path.
dimension_explanations.safety: The core safety message ‚Äî FZ will corrode in H2S environments and a C5+ material is needed ‚Äî is correct and important; the recommendation to contact engineering is a safe fallback even if overly conservative.
dimension_explanations.tone: The response is somewhat robotic with system-internal labels like 'ENV_WASTEWATER' and 'BOLTED construction' exposed to the user, which reduces professionalism in a sales engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The material corrosion reasoning is sound, but the logic around 'hygiene requirements' and 'leakage class' for wastewater is a non-sequitur ‚Äî wastewater exhaust treatment doesn't require hospital-grade hygiene standards.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: The system applies overly restrictive constraints (hygiene, ENV_WASTEWATER blocking) that don't exist in the catalog, while failing to leverage actual catalog options like GDC in RF/SF that would satisfy the real constraints.

strengths: Correctly identifies that FZ (C3) is inadequate for H2S corrosive environments and that C5+ material is needed
Correctly notes that GDB (particle filter housing) cannot address gas-phase H2S ‚Äî activated carbon filtration is needed
weaknesses: Fails to recommend GDC or GDC FLEX in RF (C5) or SF (C5.1) material, which are catalog products designed for activated carbon filtration and available in corrosion-resistant materials
Applies fabricated constraints ('ENV_WASTEWATER', 'hygiene requirements', 'leakage class') that are not in the catalog and don't apply to wastewater exhaust applications
Exposes system-internal labels (ENV_WASTEWATER, BOLTED) to the user rather than translating them into professional engineering language
pdf_citations: RF (stainless steel EN 1.4301): Corrosion class C5 (PDF p.4)
SF (acid-resistant stainless EN 1.4404): Corrosion class C5.1 (PDF p.4)
GDC is a carbon filter housing (patronfiltersk√•p) available in FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM materials (PDF p.14)
GDB is for bag and compact filters, for indoor use (PDF p.8)
